videos.title: Customizing Control Rendering in Xamarin.Forms
videos.brief: This video demonstrates how to create a custom visual renderer for a Xamarin.Forms control.

videos.title: Go Mobile with C# and Xamarin
videos.brief: Over 1,500 developers packed the main hall of Microsoft Build 2014 for a chance to see Miguel talk about the transformation of mobile development.

videos.title: Evolve 2013 Keynote
videos.brief: Nat and Miguel kick off Evolve 2013.

videos.title: How C# Saved My Marriage, Enchanced My Career, and Made Me an Inch Taller
videos.brief: Scott is a Principal Program Manager on the Web Tools team within Windows Azure and is one of the most trusted and influential voices in the .NET development community. Be informed and entertained as Scott discusses how C# saved his marriage, enhanced his career, made him an inch taller, and continues to let him create apps for any platform, any store, anywhere, anytime. His hair is still falling out however, possibly due to Silverlight.

videos.title: Multiplatformism: Lessons Learned Bringing Bastion to Six New Platforms
videos.brief: After graduating from MIT, Andrew joined Infinity Ward as an engineer on the Call of Duty: Modern Warfare franchise. Now he is the CTO of Supergiant Games, the independent studio whose first game Bastion earned more than 100 industry accolades. At Evolve 2013, Andrew will speak to the technical challenges and design goals involved in the year-long effort to bring Bastion to six new platforms.

videos.title: Buttons are a Hack
videos.brief: Josh Clark specializes in mobile design strategy and user experience. He is the founder of Global Moxie and the author of four books, including Tapworthy: Designing Great iPhone Apps. In his Evolve session, titled 'Buttons are a Hack' Josh will talk about how touch gestures are sweeping away buttons, menus and windows from mobile devices and how you can craft touchscreen interfaces that effortlessly teach users new gesture vocabularies

videos.title: Getting the Most from Xamarin Studio
videos.brief: Michael has been working on the open-source MonoDevelop IDE and other projects in the Mono ecosystem since taking part in the 2005 Summer of Code. In 2007 he joined Novell, where he was responsible for developing the IDE tooling for Mono's web, mobile and Mac technologies. At Xamarin he works on making Xamarin Studio a first-class development experience.

videos.title: Introduction to Collection Views in iOS 6
videos.brief: Collection Views are a powerful new technology in iOS 6 that allow content to be presented using arbitrary layouts. Mike will look at how to use Collection Views to create grid-like layouts, as well as how to create custom layouts.

videos.title: Android Services with C# Seminar
videos.brief: This session discusses how to develop services in C# using Mono for Android. Mike covers the basics of how Android services work and examines the various scenarios that services are used when developing Android applications.

videos.title: Optimizing CPU Performance in Xamarin apps with Instruments
videos.brief: Managing memory is crucial in mobile apps. Sometimes your app may be sluggish even if you are managing your memory perfectly. This is normally caused by a bottleneck at the CPU. Most of the slow points in my apps are easily avoidable.

videos.title: Finding Native Object Memory Leaks in Xamarin apps with Instruments
videos.brief: One of the biggest issues with mobile computing is memory. These devices have very limited memory and we need to make sure we are using and releasing it effectively.

videos.title: Delight Your Users with CoreAnimation
videos.brief: CoreAnimation is the foundation for creating high-performance and whimsical user interfaces, but is often overlooked by app developers. Frank explores all the different ways that developers can take advantage of this powerful library to delight users.

videos.title: Guide Dogs for Digital Devices
videos.brief: Modern mobile devices have been life changing for people with visual impairment. Nic Wise will cover the wealth of accessibility functions in both Android and iOS, how to use them, and why you would want to tailor your app for differently-abled people.

videos.title: Promoting and Marketing Your Mobile Applications
videos.brief: The hard work is done and your app is released on the App Store or on Google Play. How do you now make sure people know about your app and get it in on their phones?

videos.title: Push Notification - Introduction to PushSharp Seminar
videos.brief: This session goes through an introduction to Push Notifications on iOS, Android and Windows Phone, how this is implemented on the different platforms and how the open source project PushSharp can allow you to stay with C#.

videos.title: Developing iOS Map Applications with C#
videos.brief: This session will show how to use the MapKit framework to incorporate maps in iOS applications developed with C# using MonoTouch. After covering the basics needed to work with maps.

videos.title: Styling your iOS App
videos.brief: Nic Wise provides us with an introduction to iOS5 UIAppearance API's and other tools which are handy when dealing with iOS design assets, as well as some other tricks for making your MonoTouch app look amazing and perform great.

videos.title: The Disconnected Mobile Device Seminar
videos.brief: How do you architect an application that relies on a flaky Internet connection? This talk will cover local caching of models, web caching, server synchronization and UI allowances you need to make to keep the user in control and happy.

videos.title: Xamarin.Mobile - Accessing Unified Cross-Platform Features
videos.brief: Mike Bluestein takes us through the features of our unified cross-platform API that lets you use the same API to access Contacts, Location and Camera on iOS, Android and Windows Phone 7.

videos.title: Getting Started Using MonoTouch
videos.brief: Complementing Mike's Getting Started with Android seminar, Mike walked us through the basics of beginning iPhone and iPAd development with MonoTouch.

videos.title: Getting Started Using MonoForAndroid
videos.brief: If you are new to Mono for Android then this is a great place to start, watch Mike walk through getting started with Android development with C# using Mono for Android.

videos.title: Xamarin Designer for Android Demo
videos.brief: There's more information on the MonoDevelop 3.0 releases notes here: http://monodevelop.com/Download/What's_new_in_MonoDevelop_3.0#Android_UI_... and on our blog.

videos.title: Cross-Platform Mobile Development
videos.brief: Learn about cross-platform approaches to developing native applications using C# and .NET for iOS, Android, and Windows Phone 7.

videos.title: Overview of MonoGame
videos.brief: Dean Ellis gives us an overview of MonoFame, a technology used in such games as Infinite Flight and Bastion. Learn to create your own games for MonoTouch and MonoForAndroid, as well as Windows, MAc OSX and Linux, while taking advantage of XNA knowledge.

videos.title: iCloud with MonoTouch
videos.brief: Craig Dunn walks us through using iCloud features in your MonoTouch apps, using different techniques such as iCloud Key-Value Storage and iCloud Document Storage.

videos.title: New Features of MonoTouch 5.2
videos.brief: Mike has been an active member of the community since MonoTouch launched, and recently joined Xamarin's excellent documentation team. In this seminar, Mike shows the new features of MonoTouch 5.2 - MonoTouch.Dialog, Unit Testing and Memory Profiling.

videos.title: Third Party Libraries with MonoTouch and Mono for Android
videos.brief: James Clancey goes through using third party libraries for MonoTouch and Mono for Android covering the following third party libraries: Flurry Analytics, ATMHud, Facebook, Sqlite-net, Steema TeeChart, MonoGame

videos.title: Miguel de Icaza Creates an iOS Login Screen with MonoTouch.Dialog
videos.brief: Miguel demos how to create a quick login screen for iOS with MonoTouch.Dialog.

videos.title: Top 5 Features of Ice Cream Sandwich with Mono for Android 4.0
videos.brief: In this seminar, Mike shows you how to use 5 of the new APIs available to developers with Mono for Android 4.0 and Ice Cream Sandwich.

videos.title: Easily Create iOS User Interfaces with MonoTouch.Dialog
videos.brief: This video introduces MonoTouch.Dialog by way of an example that demonstrates how to create a master detail style of application.

videos.title: Getting Started with CoreGraphics
videos.brief: In this seminar, Mike shows you how to get to grips with creating 2D graphics and modify PDF files on the fly within your MonoTouch applications.
